intro: Passerina linearifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant features simple, alternate, and usually hairy leaves that are linear to narrowly elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically small and consist of numerous stamens surrounding a single pistil. Passerina linearifolia thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
